title: Clear cell papillary renal cell carcinoma
text:
Clear cell papillary renal cell carcinoma (CCPRCC) is a rare subtype of <a href="renal%20cell%20carcinoma">renal cell carcinoma</a> (RCC) that has <a href="histomorphology">microscopic morphologic features</a> of <a href="papillary%20renal%20cell%20carcinoma">papillary renal cell carcinoma</a> and <a href="clear%20cell%20renal%20cell%20carcinoma">clear cell renal cell carcinoma</a>, yet is pathologically distinct based on <a href="molecular%20pathology">molecular changes</a> and <a href="immunohistochemistry">immunohistochemistry</a>.
Pathology.
CCPRCC classically has apical nuclei, i.e. the nucleus is adjacent to the luminal aspect.
In most glandular structures the nuclei are usually basally located, i.e. in the <a href="cytoplasm">cytoplasm</a> adjacent to the <a href="basement%20membrane">basement membrane</a>.
They typically <a href="immunostain">stain</a> with <a href="CK7">CK7</a> and do not stain with <a href="TFE3">TFE3</a> and <a href="AMACR">AMACR</a>.
